page.title: 17AREA OF OUTSTANDING BEAUTY ?
page.content: A public inquiry is being held at Durham into a move by the Countryside Commission to designate part of the North Pennines (including Weardale) as an "Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty." {Many residents of Weardale {oppose the plan because of fears that {the development of traditional {industries based on mineral extraction {eg.(cement manufacture, fluorspar {processing, and limestone quarrying) {will be severely restricted and the {consequent loss of jobs and population {would lead to a decline in the level {of services.}The Countryside Commission is supported by the County Councils, The Ramblers Association, The Council for the Preservation of Rural England and other conservancy groups who argue that their primary objective is to conserve the natural beauty of the Area.
